body: @yatinmaan you might be interested in this, since you fixed #67.

I am.
I'll open an PR as soon as possible.

My suggestion would be to sort the features by "sum of importance", and then show the importance for each feature and each class side by side in a table.

(a bit like the picture at the bottom of https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/35e20d11e58218c25c8f2c3c0662aa706716243b/notebooks/tree_explainer/XGBoost%20Multi-class%20Example.ipynb, but as a ASCII table instead of an image)

@yatinmaan , hey are you working on this?
@marco-c
@saurabhdaalia the contributing rules are at https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug#contributing, you can consider all issues as unassigned until there is a PR open to fix them.

@saurabhdaalia Yes, I am still working on this.

I have modified the .ipnb mentioned above to show [the ASCII table](https://i.imgur.com/7LGiOFy.png), now I am porting that code over to bugbug.

issue.title: Add feature importance visualization for multiclass problems

labels.name: waiting-for-author
labels.description: The PR is waiting for changes from its author.

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

>

@saurabhdaalia  Could you please possibly explain in more detail what has to be done here ? ... as i want to contribute to this issue and i am a mere beginner

@spectre1811 just like you, @saurabhdaalia simply asked if he could work on this :P

@yatinmaan is already working on this and has a PR open, so this issue is assigned to him. You can choose another issue.

issue.title: Figure out a way to calculate feature importances for big models

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body: Right now, calculating importances for e.g. the component model or the defect/enhancement/task model runs out of memory.
